description: A Middle Iron Age to Early Roman site with enclosures, trackways, and field boundaries. Dating and the level of occupation is uncertain, but in the Iron Age a mortuary enclosure and ritual deposit were identified. Re-developed in the early Roman period, including a timber structure identified as a shrine.
bibliography: “Hinxton Hall Residential Block & Dining Room Extension, Archaeological Evaluation Report.” Oxford Archaeology, 2012.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Hinxton (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
